name: Cabo Verde
description: Cabo Verde, also known as the Cape Verde Islands, is a volcanic archipelago nation located off the coast of West Africa, approximately 570 kilometers (350 miles) west of Capex Verde is a nation of 10 islands, offering a unique blend of African and Portuguese cultures, stunning landscapes, and a rich maritime history. The islands boast diverse ecosystems, from arid deserts to lush valleys, and are renowned for their vibrant music, delicious cuisine, and warm hospitality.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city, a vibrant port and cultural hub.
quickFacts.detail: Praia is the economic and administrative center of Cabo Verde, offering a mix of colonial architecture, modern amenities, and lively markets.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A relatively small and welcoming population.
quickFacts.detail: The population is primarily of mixed African and Portuguese descent, with a strong Creole influence.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The official language, reflecting the country's colonial past.
quickFacts.detail: Creole (Cape Verdean Creole) is widely spoken and understood throughout the islands.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The local currency, pegged to the Euro.
quickFacts.detail: The Escudo is gradually being replaced by the West African CFA franc.

quickFacts.label: Independence
quickFacts.detail: Following independence, Cabo Verde faced economic challenges but has since stabilized and developed a thriving tourism sector.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.detail: The islands are volcanic in origin, with varying elevations and landscapes.

climateData.title: Climate
climateData.description: Cabo Verde enjoys a subtropical climate with warm temperatures year-round. The islands experience a distinct dry season (November to April) and a wet season (May to October). The trade winds provide a refreshing breeze, making it a pleasant destination for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The hottest and driest period, with clear skies and abundant sunshine.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - October)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures begin to cool slightly, and rainfall increases.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (November - March)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The coolest period, with occasional showers and stronger winds.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (April - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures gradually rise, and the landscape comes alive with greenery.

naturalWonders.name: Monte Verde
naturalWonders.description: Monte Verde is the highest point in Cabo Verde, a dormant volcano offering breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding islands. Its unique ecosystem supports a variety of endemic plant and animal species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The volcano's slopes are covered in a diverse range of vegetation, including endemic cacti and shrubs. Hiking to the summit is a challenging but rewarding experience.
viewingTips: Start early to avoid the midday heat

naturalWonders.name: Sal National Park
naturalWonders.description: Sal National Park protects a significant portion of the island of Sal, showcasing its diverse coastal ecosystems, including pristine beaches, dunes, and wetlands. It's a haven for birdlife and a popular destination for water sports.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park encompasses a variety of habitats, from sandy beaches to rocky cliffs and salt flats. It's a crucial area for the conservation of several endemic bird species.

naturalWonders.name: Lagoa do Fogo (Lake of Fire)
naturalWonders.description: Lagoa do Fogo is a stunning volcanic crater lake nestled in the heart of Santo Antão, offering dramatic scenery and a unique ecosystem. Its vibrant blue waters and surrounding cliffs create a truly unforgettable landscape.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lake is fed by rainwater and streams, creating a rich and diverse aquatic environment. The surrounding area is characterized by lush vegetation and steep cliffs.
viewingTips: Take a 4x4 vehicle to reach the lake
Bring a camera to capture the stunning views

biodiversityCategory.name: Endemic Birds
biodiversityCategory.description: Cabo Verde is a global hotspot for endemic bird species, many of which are found nowhere else on Earth. These birds have adapted to the islands' unique environments, showcasing remarkable evolutionary resilience.

statistics.details: Approximately 20% of Cabo Verde's bird species are endemic.
Due to habitat loss and invasive species, several endemic bird species are classified as threatened or endangered.

notableSpecies.name: Cape Verde Warbler
notableSpecies.significance: A critically endangered warbler found only on the islands.

notableSpecies.name: Cabo Verde Green Parrot
notableSpecies.significance: A rare parrot species endemic to the islands.

ecosystemData.title: Island Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Cabo Verde's ecosystems are shaped by its volcanic origins, subtropical climate, and isolation. The islands support a diverse range of habitats, including volcanic landscapes, coastal wetlands, and arid shrublands.

biodiversityCategories.name: Endemic Flora
biodiversityCategories.description: Cabo Verde boasts a unique flora, with many plant species found nowhere else on Earth, adapted to the islands' harsh conditions.

statistics.details: Many of these plants are drought-resistant and adapted to saline soils.

activities.title: Activities
activities.description: Cabo Verde offers a wide range of activities for visitors, from water sports and hiking to cultural experiences and wildlife viewing.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the islands' diverse landscapes on foot, from volcanic peaks to coastal trails.

activities.name: Monte Verde Hike
activities.description: A challenging hike to the summit of Monte Verde, offering panoramic views.

activities.name: Santo Antão Coastal Trails
activities.description: Explore the stunning coastal trails of Santo Antão, offering breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports in Cabo Verde's crystal-clear waters.

activities.name: Surfing
activities.description: Cabo Verde is a popular surfing destination, with consistent waves along the islands' coasts.

activities.name: Diving
activities.description: Explore the underwater world of Cabo Verde, with vibrant coral reefs and diverse marine life.

clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, waterproof jacket, sweater

equipment.hiking: Sturdy hiking boots, backpack, water bottle

safety: Be aware of the sun's intensity
